column4: How can I reload ieee80211 kernel modules for my .19 kernel and my ipw2200 driver as well.
Both got blown out and I have no internet under that kernel.
That's for Xubuntu.
You'll need to install the modules that you installed by yourself again under your new kernel
I just want to rebuild those
the default ones that come with ubuntu.
You shouldn't really have a problem as the ones that COME with ubuntu are usually already in the kernel. I could be mistaken, but I don't think i am.
No they are in /lib/modules/uname-r
So recompile and see if anythign breaks :)
They are.
And they are there because they come compiled from the kernel
I know that.
How do I replace ones that are there with their original version
You want to install OLD modules in a new kernel environment?
I suppose you could download the source for the modules and compile them with flags for your current kernel. I guess.... I don't really know... I don't see why you'd want to really do that
I think I found a way to do that.
copy the .config from the headers then make modules and copy the modules over the old ones.
I'm still not quite sure I understand what you're doing, but if it works, congrats on getting it to work

I was trying to user a different kernel module for my network card.  Well the new one I installed was messed up. So it borked my card under that kernel.  I was looking for a way to rever to the old module and think I found it.
Hm. I see. Just so you know, if I understand correct what you're doing right now, you're compiling a  new kernel with your cuyrrent running .config file, right?
Nah i'm compiling the modules to the normal .19 config
Heh, I'm not sure you know what you're doing, because the .config file is only the settings for compiling your kernel
